attributes.action: Cap the tax and "float" the tax on Highly taxed items such as fuel in order to stabilise prices
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government should limit the duty payable on fuel when prices increase. After all, if crude oil prices rise, then the tax generated rises and the government thereby raises additional funds.  

During sudden and large price increases, the government should reduce the duty payable by the consumer. If there is a shortfall in tax revenue, then the missing tax should be raised from the supplier of the fuel, in order incentivise suppliers to hold down their  prices.

In other words, the government should act to prevent the persecution of the general public by greedy companies rather than joining in with them as they do at the moment!

This approach could also be applied to Gas, Electricity, Heating Oil etc.
